Reported by the Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries. H. Rept. 101-700.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 436.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries
actions.text: Favorable Executive Comment Received from Interior.
Mr. Studds moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
The chair announced that a second on the motion to suspend the rules is not required.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 5, rule I, the chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
Considered as unfinished business.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 408 - 7 (Roll no. 367).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Fisheries and Wildlife Conservation and the Environment

official_title: To authorize appropriations to carry out the Fish and Wildlife Conservation Act of 1980 for fiscal years 1991 and 1992.

summary.text: Amends the Fish and Wildlife Conservation Act of 1980 to extend the authorization of appropriations through FY 1992.

titles.title: To authorize appropriations to carry out the Fish and Wildlife Conservation Act of 1980 for fiscal years 1991 and 1992.
